intro: Ardisia irazuensis, commonly known as the Irazú ardisia, is a species of flowering plant native to Costa Rica. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and produces small, red berries that are attractive to birds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
